decision_conditions:
The advertisement hereby approved shall comply with the following: 

The advertisement display shall be statically illuminated and the intensity of the illumination shall not exceed 400 candelas per square metre during the day and 300 candelas per square metres from dusk until dawn. The levels of luminance of the sign should be controlled by light sensors to measure the ambient brightness and dimmer to control the lighting output to within these limits.

The minimum display time for each advertisement shall be 10 seconds, the use of message sequencing for the same product is prohibited and the advertisements shall not include features/equipment which would allow interactive messages/advertisements to be displayed.

The interval between successive displays shall be instantaneous (0.1 seconds or less), the complete screen shall change, there shall be no visual effects (including fading, swiping or other animated transition methods) between successive displays and the display will include a mechanism to freeze the image in the event of a malfunction.

The signs shall not display any moving, or apparently moving, images.

There shall be no special effects (including noise, smell, smoke, animation, flashing, scrolling, three dimensional, intermittent or video elements) of any kind during the time that any message is displayed.

Reason: In the interest of the visual amenity of the area as a whole and public safety in accordance with the NPPF, the London Plan 2016 and the draft Local Plan Policy D2.
description: Removal of existing advertisement structure and display of a free standing internally illuminated LED screen advertisement hoarding (measuring 6m wide x 3m high) displayed on a metal clad advertisement structure (Advertisement Consent) together with associated landscaping
